segment.source: auditUser
segment.target: auditUser

segment.source: auditUser
segment.target: auditUser

segment.source: auditUser
segment.target: auditUser

segment.source: The auditUser configuration pass processes unattended Windows® Setup settings in user context in audit mode.
segment.target: The auditUser configuration pass processes unattended Windows® Setup settings in user context in audit mode.

segment.source: The auditUser configuration pass always runs after the auditSystem pass, which is used to apply settings in system context.
segment.target: The auditUser configuration pass always runs after the auditSystem pass, which is used to apply settings in system context.

segment.source: Typically, the auditUser configuration pass is used to execute RunSynchronous or RunAsynchronous commands.
segment.target: Typically, the auditUser configuration pass is used to execute RunSynchronous or RunAsynchronous commands.

segment.source: These commands are used to run scripts, applications, or other executables during audit mode.
segment.target: These commands are used to run scripts, applications, or other executables during audit mode.

segment.source: When Windows boots to audit mode, the auditSystem and auditUser settings for unattended Windows Setup are processed.
segment.target: When Windows boots to audit mode, the auditSystem and auditUser settings for unattended Windows Setup are processed.

segment.source: Audit mode enables OEMs and corporations to install additional device drivers, applications, and other updates to a master Windows® image.
segment.target: Audit mode enables OEMs and corporations to install additional device drivers, applications, and other updates to a master Windows® image.

segment.source: By using audit mode, you can maintain fewer images because you can create a reference image with a minimal set of drivers and applications.
segment.target: By using audit mode, you can maintain fewer images because you can create a reference image with a minimal set of drivers and applications.

segment.source: The reference image can then be updated with additional drivers during audit mode.
segment.target: The reference image can then be updated with additional drivers during audit mode.

segment.source: Additionally, you can test and resolve any issues related to malfunctioning or incorrectly installed devices on the Windows image before shipping the computer to a customer.
segment.target: Additionally, you can test and resolve any issues related to malfunctioning or incorrectly installed devices on the Windows image before shipping the computer to a customer.

segment.source: Audit mode is optional.
segment.target: Audit mode is optional.

segment.source: The following diagram illustrates when the auditUser configuration pass is processed in audit mode.
segment.target: The following diagram illustrates when the auditUser configuration pass is processed in audit mode.

segment.source: auditmode configuration pass
segment.target: auditmode configuration pass

segment.source: The auditUser configuration pass runs only when you configure Windows Setup to boot into audit mode.
segment.target: The auditUser configuration pass runs only when you configure Windows Setup to boot into audit mode.

segment.source: You can boot to audit mode by using the sysprep /audit or sysprep /generalize /audit commands, or you can specify the Reseal setting in the Microsoft-Windows-Deployment component.
segment.target: You can boot to audit mode by using the sysprep /audit or sysprep /generalize /audit commands, or you can specify the Reseal setting in the Microsoft-Windows-Deployment component.

segment.source: For more information about audit mode, see Audit Mode Overview and Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.
segment.target: For more information about audit mode, see Audit Mode Overview and Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.
